ygData.subject: Crawl failure details
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks for responding, Gordon. I am running Ubuntu *.10 (Intrepid) and Java 1.6.0_0 IcedTea6 1.3.1 (6b12-0ununtu6.4) Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_0-b12)

Thanks for responding, Gordon.

I am running Ubuntu *.10 (Intrepid) and Jav=
a 1.6.0_0 IcedTea6 1.3.1 (6b12-0ununtu6.4) Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0=
_0-b12) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 1.6.0_0-b12, mixed-mode)

I am usin=
g Heritrix 1.14.3

I selected a new job with defaults.  I specified the see=
d http://www.cs.nmt.edu (my school's CS Dept. web site)
I chose org.archive=
.crawler.scope.BroadScope 
Then org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbFrontier
I =
used NO preprocessor to prevent such domain elimination.
Fetchers: org.arch=
ive.crawler.fetcher.FetchDNS
      and org.archive.crawler.fetcher.FetchHTT=
P
I used several Extractors:
   org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorHTTP=

   org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorHTML
   org.archive.crawler.extr=
actor.ExtractorCSS
   org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorJS
   org.arch=
ive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorSWF
I used one Writer:
   org.archive.crawle=
r.writer.ARCWriterProcessor
I used three Post Processors:
   org.archive.cr=
awler.postprocessor.CrawlStateUpdater	
   org.archive.crawler.postprocessor=
.LinksScoper
   org.archive.crawler.postprocessor.FrontierScheduler
Finally=
, I selected one Statistics Tracker:
   org.archive.crawler.admin.Statistic=
sTracker
I then specified nothing on the Submodules Page

On the Setting pa=
ge, I specified valid user-agent: and from: fields
Then I altered the defau=
lt Archiver#decide-rules suffix from ${HOSTNAME} to ${Rough-Writer} - which=
 is correct.
At that point I submitted the job & I had a new pending job.

=
Next I started the job.  It immediately completed and the totals on the scr=
een showed 0 downloaded but one job queued.  The terminal shows no files of=
 form *.arc

I looked into a produced file (local-errors.log) and saw a top=
 line:
2009-04-07T03:16:31.659Z    -2          - http://www.cs.nmt.edu/ - -=
 no-type #045 - - - le:IOException@HTTP
2nd line was: java.io.IOException: =
Failed to get host www.cs.nmt.edu address from ServerCache
These were follo=
wed by a slew of seemingly induced  internal errors.

So I wonder how is th=
e address of my seed supposed to get INTO the cache?

Can you help me decod=
e any of this?  I am saving all my results for later examination.

Thanks
-=
Rich B.
